stack writes:
> Embarrassingly, we didn't spend enough time looking.  More writers would 
> mean more contention for the disk head possibly holding threads in the 
> write step for longer but iostat at the time didn't seem to show this as 
> being the issue -- the disk was lightly loaded (Generally we don't put 
> up much of a disk i/o loading, not unless you disable gzipping).

That would make sense. Now that you can specify multiple ARC
directories, you could spread writers across multiple drives. One
thing that I haven't done in my large crawl is put the logging and
scratch on separate disks: doing that would certainly help.
